text: Map with no arguments and class method?

code:
# builtins work fine:
>>> map (str, [(), (), ()])
['()', '()', '()']

# but no luck for class methods:
>>> class C (object):
...   def m(self):
...     return 42
... 
>>> c = C()
>>> map(c.m, [(), (), ()])
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: m() takes exactly 1 argument (2 given)
